chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM -> FRACTRAN_PROBLEM

Goal:
FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING ⪯ FRACTRAN_HALTING

Premises:
FRACTRAN_HALTING = fun P : FRACTRAN_PROBLEM => let (l, x) := P in l /F/ x ↓ : FRACTRAN_PROBLEM -> Prop
FRACTRAN_PROBLEM = (list (nat * nat) * nat)%type : Set
FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING = fun H : FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM => let (l, s) := H in let (n, v) := s in l /F/ ps 1 * exp 1 v ↓ : FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM -> Prop
FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM = (list (nat * nat) * {n : nat & vec nat n})%type : Set
reduces_transitive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop) (Z : Type) (R : Z -> Prop), P ⪯ Q -> Q ⪯ R -> P ⪯ R
MM_FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING = let f := fun H : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := H in let (P, v) := s in let s0 := mm_fractran_n P in let (l, a) := s0 in match a with | conj _ _ => (l, existT (fun n0 : nat => vec nat n0) n v) end in ex_intro (fun f0 : MM_PROBLEM -> FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM => reduction f0 MM_HALTING FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING) f (fun x : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) as s return (MM_HALTING s <-> FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING (f s)) := x in let (P, v) as s0 return (MM_HALTING (existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n0)) & vec nat n0}) n s0) <-> FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING (f (existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n0)) & vec nat n0}) n s...
red_comp : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (q : Y -> Prop), p ⪯ q -> (fun x : X => ~ p x) ⪯ (fun y : Y => ~ q y)
reduces_reflexive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), P ⪯ P
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [f := fun H : FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM => let (l, s) := H in let (n, v) := s in (l, ps 1 * exp 1 v) : FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM -> FRACTRAN_PROBLEM |- nat]
FRACTRAN_HALTING_l_0_no_zero_den : forall l : list (nat * nat), l <> nil -> fractran_regular l -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (l, 0) < -> False
FRACTRAN_HALTING_hard : forall (p : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), p <> 0 -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (((p, 0) :: l)%list, 0) < -> (exists x : nat, x <> 0 /\ FRACTRAN_HALTING (((p, 0) :: l)%list, x))
FRACTRAN_HALTING_l_1_no_zero_den : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (x : nat), l <> nil -> x <> 0 -> List.Forall (fun c : nat * nat => fst c <> 0) l -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (l, x) < -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (List.filter (fun c : nat * nat => if PeanoNat.Nat.eq_dec (snd c) 0 then false else true) l, x)
reduces_dependent : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop), P ⪯ Q < -> inhabited (forall x : X, {y : Y | P x <-> Q y})
FRACTRAN_HALTING_on_zero_first_no_zero_den : forall (p q : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), q <> 0 -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (((p, q) :: l)%list, 0) < -> False
FRACTRAN_HALTING_nil_x : forall x : nat, FRACTRAN_HALTING (nil, x) < -> True
FRACTRAN_HALTING_0_num : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (x : nat), List.Exists (fun c : nat * nat => fst c = 0) l -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (l, x) < -> False
FRACTRAN_HALTING_zero_num : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (x : nat), List.Exists (fun c : nat * nat => fst c = 0) l -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (l, x) < -> False
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
rel_iter.rel_iter : forall X : Type, (X -> X -> Prop) -> nat -> X -> X -> Prop
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
sss_compute : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_output : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_step : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
Inductive ZArithProof : Type := DoneProof : ZMicromega.ZArithProof | RatProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | CutProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | EnumProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZWitness -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | ExProof : BinNums.positive -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof Arguments ZMicromega.EnumProof _ _ _%list_scope Arguments ZMicromega.ExProof _%positive_scope
sss_terminates : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> Prop
reduction = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => forall x : X, P x < -> Q (f x) : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduction {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
reduces = fun (X Y : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => exists f : X -> Y, reduction f P Q : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduces {X Y}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
VarMap.find : forall A : Type, A -> VarMap.t A -> BinNums.positive -> A
List.filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
RingMicromega.Build_Formula : forall T : Type, EnvRing.PExpr T -> RingMicromega.Op2 -> EnvRing.PExpr T -> RingMicromega.Formula T
encode_dec : forall n : nat, nat -> pos n -> nat -> nat * nat
encode_dec2 : forall n : nat, nat -> pos n -> nat -> nat * nat
utils_list.Forall_impl : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop) (ll : list X), (forall x : X, List.In x ll -> P x -> Q x) -> List.Forall P ll -> List.Forall Q ll
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
Inductive PExpr (C : Type) : Type := PEc : C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEX : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEadd : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEsub : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEmul : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEopp : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEpow : EnvRing.PExpr C -> BinNums.N -> EnvRing.PExpr C Arguments EnvRing.PExpr _%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEc {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEX {C}%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEadd {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEsub {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEmul {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEopp {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEpow {C}%type_scope _ _%N_scope
utils_tac.measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
Inductive Mon : Set := mon0 : Ring_polynom.Mon | zmon : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon | vmon : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon Arguments Ring_polynom.zmon _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.vmon _%positive_scope
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> EnvRing.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C | PX : EnvRing.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C Arguments EnvRing.Pol _%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.Pc {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.Pinj {C}%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments EnvRing.PX {C}%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | PX : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C Arguments Ring_polynom.Pol _%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pc [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pinj [C]%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PX [C]%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
prime_divides : forall p q : nat, prime.prime p -> prime.prime q -> gcd.divides p q -> p = q
Build_primestream : forall str : nat -> nat, (forall n m : nat, str n = str m -> n = m) -> (forall n : nat, prime.prime (str n)) -> primestream
fractran_steps = fun l : list (nat * nat) => rel_iter.rel_iter (fractran_step l) : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_steps _%list_scope (_ _ _)%nat_scope

```intros f.
exists (fun P => let (l, s) := P in let (n, v) := s in l /F/ ps 1 * exp 1 v ↓).
intro H.
apply H.```

original: intros f. exists (fun P => let (l, s) := P in let (n, v) := s in l /F/ ps 1 * exp 1 v ↓). intro H. apply H.
